file_content.text: Didn't waste time cutting to the heart of the matter, Jedi.
You work fast, I'll give you that.
Sources tell me you were the one that took the Star Fortress offline.
Gets on my nerves, how easy you make it look.
Preparation and determination, Zenith, no different than you.
Hmph, understatement. And the Force always helps.
It's only because I have the support of capable allies. Like you.
Silver tongue still works.
You would not be the first to envy my gifts.
Nevermind.
Would have only trusted the Barsen'thor to accomplish something like that.
That title is rarely bestowed. You honor me with the comparison.
Why I said it.
I am a lord of the Sith. It would be wise to remember the power I wield.
No risk of me letting my guard down around you.
Not as dicey as my op on the Gauntlet, but the fortress didn't fall easily.
Havoc propaganda always seemed too good to be true. Maybe not.
Eh, I spent all my bad luck at the sabacc tables last week, so I figured I was due.
That pass for humble?
Just gotta put your mind and a whole lot of explosives to it.
We work together, I handle planning.
Infiltration and sabotage are my specialties.
Don't think I've forgotten.
You knew the Warden of the Order?
Who or what is the Barsen'thor?
A Jedi. The title meant protector, something close enough. Well-earned.
Worked toward liberating Balmorra together, and a lot more from there. It's a high compliment.
Did you call me here just for flattery?
Wouldn't get used to that thought.
With the Star Fortress out of the way, not much reason to keep operating on Nar. You've got plans elsewhere, I'm interested.
Plans that could benefit from your pragmatism and perspective. Welcome to the Alliance.
Thanks.
I don't think I could keep you from the battle for freedom even if I wanted to.
Probably not.
If you're as resourceful as I'm told, I'll gladly accept your help.
Good.
Just remember that they're my plans. I'll expect you to follow orders.
Don't think I'll never question you. Won't undermine your mission though.
Was afraid you might have gone and changed on me.
Wasn't sure you'd have it in you.
Had half a mind to leave you up there.
You did well though, did what needed to be done. No matter what comes next, the galaxy just saw Zakuul bleed.
I know you aren't one for large groups, but I'm hoping this means you'll join my Alliance.
Does this mean I have your future cooperation?
They won't be able to pretend they're invulnerable anymore.
We have their attention. It'll take more to really shake them.
Did you enjoy hitting them back as much as I did?
Doubt it.
Things are only going to escalate. I don't think we'll be the ones who suffer for it.
Humiliating them will come at a cost. Don't think we'll be the ones paying.
We don't own their atrocities.
Still a lot of work ahead, think I'll make bigger strides on your side.
So long as the Eternal Empire's a threat, count on my support.
Glad you could make it, Jedi.
Your timing is suspiciously good. Maybe that Force you put your trust in brought you my way again.
Been planning an attack on the Zakuul Star Fortress here for months. Think you could make that a reality.
Removing the Star Fortresses is a goal of mine--tell me more.
You accomplish anything you set your mind to, with or without me.
Getting it done, I can do. Getting it done with minimal sacrifices? That's your talent.
I haven't agreed to anything yet.
Hear me out.
Kept up your end of the bargain. Give you that much.
My people have reported some attacks on the Star Fortress in orbit here. Safe to assume that was you?
Those fortresses are a symbol of oppression that I cannot abide.
That makes two of us.
It's important to test the capabilities of our enemy.
Hope you learned something. Like you to do it again.
It is a prime strategic target.
Might be "the" strategic target.
They're double-parked in front of my favorite moon.
Funny.
My enemies quickly learn that no place is safe from my wrath.
Mine too.
I have designs in motion for those strongholds.
That's what I wanted to hear.
Might have had a reason to expend some ammo on it.
Let me give you another one.
Your people have sharp ears.
Wouldn't last long without them.
Why does that interest you, Zenith?
Had plans of my own to hit it.
It's insulting. The way they leave their machines to mind us like livestock.
Overconfidence they'll pay for.
Resources are welcome, but I need to see how you really operate.
Got an opportunity here on Nar. Eternal Empire keeps tabs on our HoloNet from the fortress in orbit. Aim to send a message through their network then destroy it.
Give Arcann a black eye and show the rest of the galaxy it's possible.
It won't be as simple as you make it sound.
Well aware of that.
You have a way to accomplish that?
Been planning something for awhile now. Rather see how you handle it.
That would certainly show that they aren't invincible.
Plenty could stand to learn that, them most of all.
Even if we succeed, the retaliation will be monstrous.
Doing nothing isn't an option.
You're the only one I know of that's been inside a Star Fortress. That's the only reason we're having this conversation.
I've heard you're resourceful, but this will be the most dangerous thing you've ever done. Can I count on you?
I'm prepared.
You've been getting the best of this arrangement. If I do this for you, you need to start pulling weight for my Alliance.
I'm done placating you, Zenith. I'll only do this if you agree to join the Alliance.
Deal.
Nobody has been inside the Star Fortress. No telling what Zakuul could have waiting for us.
Going in blind is a lot to ask of anyone. I've seen what the Eternal Empire can bring to bear.
So have I.
Follow my lead and I'll make sure we survive this.
I'll be fine.
This sounds like a suicide mission.
Could be. Might be worth it, things go right.
Been fighting the Eternal Empire for years. Learned a thing or two. One way or another, we're sending Zakuul a message.
Contact me when you're ready to go in. I'll be waiting.
You've done well. Want your chance to prove you have what it takes for this, meet at the attached coordinates.
Got a decent stockpile going. Prepping for something big. Make a few more shipments.
Putting the supplies to good use. Keep it up.
It's a start.
[Theron's Dataspike hijacks the HoloNet feed. You can hear half of Nar Shaddaa cry out as you interrupt the Huttball Quarterfinals.]
Hope this still works... "Two perspectives are aligned."
[You hope your message got through as the broadcast is wrestled back from you.]
Figured the ghosts of my past were catching up. Didn't expect this.
You have allies. Reach out.
Zenith. Enough skulking. We need to talk.
[You hope your message got through as the broadcast is wrestled back from you.]
Subtle.
Long time, Jedi.
Back to your old habits. What happened to Zenith the politician?
Zakuul happened.
I'm glad to find you alive. I had visions of your death.
Had some close calls. Still kicking. Was never sure about you. Looked bad.
You could sound a little more pleased to see me.
Back at you.
What made you contact me?
I'm leading an Alliance against the Eternal Empire. I need people like you.
When I heard you were alive, I wanted to reach out. Good allies are hard to come by.
Sad truth.
Wouldn't mind working with you again. Not many I'd trust to beat Zakuul.
Your methods are extreme. I'm afraid they might result in deaths for my people if you go unchecked.
I don't need you policing me.
Keeping off each other's toes I can live with.
Got something big in the works. Help wrap it up, might free my time.
If it gives the Eternal Empire pause, I'm interested.
What sort of big, Zenith?
Not over holo.
I'm not going to like this, am I?
Shouldn't ruffle your feathers.
Rather we discuss this in person. Come to these coordinates if you're interested.
Good seeing you, Jedi.
Got one minute. More than you deserve.
I'm told you've been making trouble for the Eternal Empire. We have that in common.
No need to be suspicious. I'm a friend.
There's always a need.
You're going to be a joy to work with, I can tell already.
Thirty seconds.
I run an Alliance against the Eternal Empire. We take all kinds. Interested?
Like my way just fine.
Want me to work with you, give a reason: guns, ammo, armor and explosives work fine.
I'm offering my help. Against the Eternal Empire. You want it or not?
You want to help, my operation needs supplies. Guns, ammo, armor, explosives. Handle that, we'll talk.
Whatever you have to say: save it. Walk away or I put you where I put Lachris.
Will you topple the Eternal Empire alone then?
I'm not alone.
You took Balmorra for the Republic? That was a long time ago.
Not half as long as you spent destroying it.
And who occupies it now? Our common enemy.
It was a colossal waste for us to have fought so long. Let's not do it again.
You are not guiltless. Submission would have allowed Balmorra to prosper.
Not up for debate. You're wasting my time.
A world that spirited required a stern hand.
Lachris was too lenient on your insolent people. Better to have purged you and begun again.
Likewise.
No love lost between the Republic and I, but killing Chancellor Janarus? Unforgivable.
Whatever it is to you, it was just a job to me.
What I do to you won't be.
He and his cronies tried to ruin me.
Imperial attack dogs deserve what they get.
Yeah, I don't care for the new Supreme Chancellor either. My bad.
That funny?
Maybe, but it looks great on a resume.
Hope it looks as good in your obituary.
Finally meet the Imperial side of my coin. The Republic may pardon your actions. I won't. Balmorra won't.
Think I killed more Imperials than anything, including an admiral.
Expecting thanks?
I'm Mandalorian, not Imperial.
Faulty ideology. Conquerors, depraved and deluded. Might as well be Sith.
I'm not Imperial anything. They pay, I work.
Collaborator. Accomplice. Makes no difference to me.
What do you mean "Imperial side of your coin?"
Hunted and feared. Labeled terrorist. Similarities end there.
Don't worry, got no plans to go back to that cratered, bug-crusted dump.
I plan to bury you there.
You. Took a long time to find out who betrayed Gray Star. Intel said you were dead. Wrong, but that can be fixed.
Gray Star saw that peace was preferable to endless violence and surrendered. Willingly.
Seen how the Sith Empire "convinces."
He was the unwitting pawn of a madman. I was, too. I unraveled his scheme in the end, if it's any consolation.
It isn't. All you did is clean up your own mess.
You made a mistake showing your face.
Don't threaten me, Zenith. I've seen every play in your book and a million more besides.
Don't need tricks. Just patience and opportunity.
Balmorra was a quagmire for your people and mine. Let's not repeat it.
You've been carrying this grudge for a while now.
My only regret.
We both have larger foes to deal with. Foes we can't stand alone against. I propose a truce.
I regret it too, but bigger things were at play. Just like now.
That's your angle? Unite against Zakuul.
Forget everything, work together. Only tried that because I trusted the Barsen'thor. Didn't work.
Doing things my way again.
I came here to help. What will it take to convince you?
And I want you to keep at it. I just think we could accomplish more by cooperating.
So you'd rather squabble while Arcann keeps our galaxy under his heel?
I don't squabble.
You want to help. My people need weapons, armor, explosives, ammo. Supply me, maybe we'll talk more.
Dead drops only. Don't contact me again.
Only one? You're fortunate. I'm here to talk about the future, not dredge up the past.
Too late for that.
He was terrorist filth. Gunning him down was a mercy he didn't deserve.
I played you all like fools, Gray Star most of all.
We survived you. You won't survive me.
Don't even blink. That's when I'll find you.
There. That terminal.
Done. HoloNet's going to be active tonight.
You lead, just keep an eye out for their HoloNet hub.
Spending too many charges breaching blast doors. Going to have to improvise.
Not interested.
You're resourceful, but this mission will not be easy. Are you ready?
[Insert Theron's dataspike into the holoterminal]
[Insert Theron's dataspike into the holoterminal]
[Walk away]
